brief_summary.textblock:
This proposal will address the existent gaps in the literature by identifying barriers and
      facilitators to participation in physical activity in inner-city minority elementary
      schoolchildren with asthma, more that half of whom are also overweight; developing and
      refining a school-based intervention in partnership with the community to improve physical
      activity; and conducting a pilot randomized controlled trial of the intervention to
      determine feasibility and obtain preliminary data for a future large-scale trial.

clinical_study.brief_title: Addressing Barriers to Physical Activity in Inner-City Schoolchildren With Asthma

detailed_description.textblock:
Four schools have been recruited for  pilot wait-listed cluster randomized clinical trial to
      determine feasibility for a large-scaled trial. Community-based participatory research
      approach was utilized to develop an intervention that will be delivered to two schools. Two
      control schools will receive intervention during year 2 of the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  children with active asthma attending 2nd-4th grades in Bronx

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  other medical conditions preventing participation in physical activity

intervention.description: School- and community-based intervention includes several components: a classroom-based physical activity program, asthma awareness week at the school, asthma education for parents and students enrolled in the study, collaboration with child's physician to ensure proper medical treatment of child's asthma asthma education for school personnel

facility.name: Children's Hospital at Montefiore, Albert Einstein College of Medicine

clinical_study.official_title: Addressing Barriers to Physical Activity in Inner-City Schoolchildren With Asthma

other_outcome.description: days with asthma symptoms will be assessed by parental self-report
other_outcome.measure: change in days with asthma symptoms

overall_official.affiliation: Children's Hospital at Montefiore, Albert Einstein College of Medicine

primary_outcome.description: physical activity levels will be measured with accelerometers

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: BMI will be assessed by measuring height and weight of children

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
